abstract: The former top lawyer at Apple on Thursday agreed to pay $2.2 million to settle federal regulators’ charges that she altered company records to conceal improper backdating of stock options for senior managers, including the chief executive, Steven P. Jobs.
lead_paragraph: The former top lawyer at Apple on Thursday agreed to pay $2.2 million to settle federal regulators’ charges that she altered company records to conceal improper backdating of stock options for senior managers, including the chief executive, Steven P. Jobs.

headline.main: Former Apple Executive Settles Backdating Suit
